intro: Herpestis cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban herb of the devil, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The species is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
